title: schools shut london false widow spiders
story: Two primary schools and two secondary schools have closed after Britains most venomous spider was found on site.The discovery of the spiders were made by Newhams Environmental Team in east London.Pest control teams are now working to bring the outbreak under control before any more eggs hatch.One of the schools affected, Rokeby secondary in Canning Town, will remain shut until October .Star Primary in Beckton, Ellen Wilkinson Primary in Canning Town and Lister Community School in Plaistow have also had to close until further notice.Rokeby head teacher, Charlotte Robinson, said a pest control company estimated it would take three weeks to clear the spiders.In a letter to parents of the school’s  pupils, she wrote: “I have had to take the dficult decision to close Rokeby School to students and staff until Monday, October .“We have engaged a company to deal with and eradicate this pest, they have estimated that this will take up to three weeks.“The safety and wellbeing of students and staff must be our priority so whilst I understand that this may be very inconvenient for you it is in your child’s best interest to remain at home and not at school.”Lister Community School head teacher Anthony Wilson said he hoped his school would re-open by Friday.He added: “Investigations suggest that there may be some of these spiders on our site, and we are therefore following advice from the local authority and will be closing the school as a precaution to allow full investigation.”Lisle Von Buchenroder, headteacher at Star Primary and Sue Ferguson, headteacher of Ellen Wilkinson said they were looking at alternative venues so lessons could continue.False widow spiders are about the size of a p coin and are the most dangerous spider species in the UK.Their bites can be very painful and leave small puncture marks on the skin.A Newham Council spokeswoman said: “The spiders only bitemishandled or provoked. The venom is not particularly potent.“The schools are being treated and fumigated and we are working with the schools to ensure that children can continue to receive an education whilst their school is closed.Pupils are being set work via the schools and will remain in contact with schools.“We are asking all our schools and nurseries to proactively check their premises carefully for these spiders andthey see any signs, then contact environmental health or pest control.”False widow spiders are distinctive for their shiny, black flesh, bulbous bodies, thick legs and skull-like patterns.Millions of  widows, Britains most venomous spider, have been found across the UK and the population is believed to be growing.The species has a brown bulbous abdomen with cream markings that look like a skull. They have long legs and can reach about mm in size.Also known as steatoda nobilis, the spider is frequently confused for the black widow, which has deadly venom.

title: theresa may dancing abba trolled guy verhofstadt
story: Brussels’ chief spokesman Margaritis Schinas was asked about the Prime Minister’s on-stage antics yesterday, when she walked out to “Dancing Queen”.He responded with the names of several other of the Swedish band’s songs – adding that “breaking up is never easy, I know”.It came after Mrs May was last night trolled by EU Parliament boss Guy Verhofstadt, who evidently missed the funny side of her light-hearted move at the Tory conference in Birmingham.On Twitter last night he sneered: While dancing to ABBA today, PM May overlooked the fact that Bjorn from ABBA called Brexit a disaster.He shared a link to the singer discussing why he wanted Britain to stay in the bloc, which was filmed before the referendum in  where most Brits opted to leave.But Winston Churchills grandson Nicholas Soames was quick to hit back with a tweet saying: #ohbuggeroff!Today Mr Schinas was asked by a reporter an Abba-themed question, whether he would: “Take a chance on May or is Britain facing its Waterloo ”And he replied in kind, saying: My my, how can I resist you. We appreciate a bit of dancing - it always takes two to tango.“We prefer that the tune was Dancing Queen rather than the Winner Takes It All. What can I say  Breaking up is never easy, I know.The PM’s moves did win some plaudits among the EU though, with Swedens ambassador saying last night: I can only say Bravo to Theresa May for starting her conference speech with ABBAs Dancing Queen.Mrs Mays dancing yesterday sent the internet wild with hilarious memes.Social media went into meltdown after she once again showed off her moves at the start of her speech this afternoon.The Tory leader went viral earlier this year after she danced with schoolchildren in South Africa - and didnt hesitate to show off her moves again as she took to the stage in Birmingham.Sharing a meme of Strictly judge Craig Revel Horwood, one joked: I can only assume that the reason Theresa May is dancing so much recently is so that she has a shot at getting on Strictly in  once she gets forced out.Mrs May also used her speech to announce a freeze to fuel duty for another year, a council house revolution by lting the cap on how much authorities can borrow - and revealed the pain of losing her goddaughter to cancer as she unveiled a new strategy to detect diseases earlier.

title: homeowner stunned to find 6ft snake lurking in her sewing room so can you spot it
story: The snake hid itself in amongst the clutter of the room, but can YOU spot the scaly visitor Snake Catchers Brisbane, Logan, Ipswich and Gold Coast were called out to the Sherwood property in Brisbane, Australia, yesterday.The Queensland base snake snaring service said on Facebook: “We got called out to a snake that had made itself quite comfortable here in a sewing room.”Snake catcher Jasmine Zeleny identied the scaly stowaway as a coastal carpet python measuring more than six foot in .She said: “They can reach as long as three metres .“Theyre a non-venomous species, and they do very well in an urban environment.”Jasmine added that it was one of the most commonly caught snakes in Brisbane and generally ate rats and possums.She suspects the python crept in the easy way adding: “Sometimes its as simple as leaving the door to the room open.”The snake catching group posted the photo of the snake to their Facebook page, and teased users to seethey could spot the reptile.Bemused users have piled in with their thoughts and comments on the stealthy serpent.One said: “That gives me the heebie jeebies.”Another took aim at the tidiness off the room joking: “This is not a sewing room. It is a storage area in need of help.”Tania Heather added: OMG how did he get up there Janice Thompson chimed in with: I thought under the basket The business describes itself as south east Queenslands oldest and most experienced professional snake catching business.

title: clear simple pregnancy tests recalled wrong results
story: Some , faulty Clear and Simple digital pregnancy tests are being recalled after a number of the at-home testing kits provided  positive results.The Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agencyhas issued a recall of the affected batches.Dr Duncan McPherson, clinical director of medical devices at the MHRA, said: It is important people check the lot number of any Clear  Simple Digital Pregnancy Tests they have purchased to seethey have a product from an affected lot.If you have any questions about using digital pregnancy tests, please speak to your healthcare professional.Patient safety is our highest priority. We strongly encourage anyone to report any issues with this product, or more generally with any medical device, to our yellow card scheme.”Catalogue number: DM-Lot number: DMEExpiration date: Jan If you pregnancy test is from this batch you shouldit to your pharmacy.Tests on a number of kits from this batch have produced  positive results.A  positive pregnancy test result means youre not pregnant but the test says you are, a heartbreaking scenario for many women.Home tests work by detecting levels of the pregnancy hormone human chorionic gonadotropinin your wee.HAVE YOU BEEN AFFECTED  Email us at andrea.downey@the-sun or call   . You can WhatsApp us on   .Some ask you to hold the stick in a cup of your pee for a few seconds, others ask you to pee with what seems like impossible accuracy, directly on to the stick.There are many things that can cause a  positive result, from using the test wrong to hormone imbalances and medication.In this case, a fault in the design of the Clear and Simple test meant more urine could pass through the testing strip, leading to a  positive result.Home tests work by detecting levels of the pregnancy hormone human chorionic gonadotropinin your wee.Most tests are about  per cent accurate when used correctly, but they are NOT fail-proof.Clear and Simple tests are being recalled for a manufacturing fault, but there are other reasons a test can tell you youre pregnant when youre not.Heres some of the reasons you may experience a  positive result.

title: thomas cook holiday customers egypt food raw meat
story: Nikk Malee, , watched the servers pick the raw meat off trays to cook it – before placing it back on the same trays ready to serve to guests at a hotel in the same beach resort town where two Brits died.The woman, of Scarborough, North Yorkshire, was so horried that she cut her two-week holiday in Hurghada short – eating only rice and bread until she could leave to avoid any potential food poisoning.And Nikk, who is confined to a wheelchair due to osteoarthritis, said she was frustrated her concerns were initially brushed off by Thomas Cook – despite the series of food hygiene concerns raised from the holiday destination in recent months.Two Brits John Cooper, , and his we Susan, , died suddenly at an Egypt hotel barely half an hour down the road.Speaking to the Sun Online, Nikk said: “People need to be made aware that their lives are being put at risk by companies that have no interest in their welfare.”Thomas Cook today confirmed the chef involved has been suspended after an investigation into the incident.Nikk had been staying at Tropitel Sahl Hasheesh in Hurghada in August with her husband and carer Malcolm when she said she spotted the mishandling of the food as they prepared for a BBQ.She said: “They were bringing the meat off the small trays and started cooking it on the grill.“Then they took the same small trays, put a liner in and put the cooked meat – chicken and koftas - back onto the trays.“All the time cooking, they didn’t wash their hands and only wiped them on a piece of paper.”Nikk filmed the chefs, with the cooks seen flipping the meat on an open fire before going back to handle the raw meat.After the incident, she said: “I couldn’t feel comfortable eating there.“I ate bread alone.”The horried woman said her trip to Egypt had been ruined – demanding to be taken home a week early and moved to a dferent hotel in the meantime.She said she demanded for the BBQ to be cancelled that night, but was told it would be impossible.Instead, a meeting was organised with the hotel manager for the next morning.She said: “I told him ‘You’re going to make guests ill’.“He said he would talk them through hygiene again but I said it wasn’t good enough – that’s where you get these deaths from.”Frustrated Nikk also claimed staff had told her to delete the video, with it taking weeks for Thomas Cook to pay attention to her complaints.Since news of the sudden deaths of John and Susan Cooper, scores of tourists have described being served raw chicken and suffering food poisoning at the Steigenberger Aqua Magic in Hurghada, Egypt, this summer.A Thomas Cook spokesperson said: “We want all of our customers to enjoy their holidays with us and we are very sorry that Mr and Mrs Mallee did not enjoy their stay.“After receiving the complaint we gave them a hotel upgrade and arranged early flights home at no extra cost.“Following our investigation the hotel has suspended the chef and is putting measures in place to ensure that this doesn’t happen again.”

title: emmanuel macron stop brexit second eu referendum
story: The Prime Minister warned the rest of her ministers that the French hardline boss is holding out hope that another referendum could be on the cards.And it might push EU leaders into giving us a bad dealthey think they can force another vote where Britain opts to stay in the bloc, The Times reported.The French President is pushing for the EU to pursue a hardline approach with Mrs May in Brexit talks - and is said to be among several members who want to punish us for leaving.He told other leaders that Britains current Chequers deal wouldnt stand in the EU - and threatened to block another special summit to finalise a deal unless the PM made more concessions.The French president has warned that a trade deal with Britain cant come at the expense of the EUs integrity.But meddling Mr Macron launched an extraordinary attack on the leaders of the leave campaign during the referendum after the Salzburg summit.He branded Brexiteers as liars just hours after the EU tore apart Mrs Mays Brexit plans.And he said last month that Britain should for sure reverse Brexit because voters didnt realise how complex it would be.He denied meddling with British politics but said he would welcome the UK ing to the EU.However, Mr Macron has been using Brexit to his advantage - reportedly flying over top CEOs on private jets over to France for meetings.He has made no secret of his desire to nick British jobs after we leave, especially in the financial services sector which London competes fiercely with Paris for.Today EU boss Donald Tusk hit out at Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunts insulting comments comparing the EU to the Soviet Union over Brexit.But he also piled pressure on Mrs May to ditch her hated Chequers plans and go for a Canada-style free trade agreement instead.

title: mother lets toddler use potty plane aisle shocked cabin crew
story: The unidentied woman was pictured crouching down as her child uses the potty just feet away from other passengers.The photograph was posted on the passengershaming Instagram account, dedicated to the gross behaviour of travellers.After being spotted by cabin crew and asked to use the vacant toilet the woman reportedly replied: “I don’t give a s**t.”Passengershaming said “obviously not shaming or identying the child. title: foetus found valentines park ilford london mum
story: The body - believed to be around - weeks gestation - was discovered in a garden area at Valentines Park in Ilford.Police and paramedics rushed to the scene at :am on Thursday morning after receiving a call from a member of the public.Officers are concerned for the mothers welfare and are asking her to contact emergency services immediately so that she can receive medical treatment.A politan Police statement read: Police are appealing for information following the discovery of a foetus at a park in east London.Officers are concerns for the welfare of the mother and are urging her to contact police.Police were called at :hrs on Thursday,  October, to reports of a foetus found in gardens at the northern end of Valentines Park in Cranbrook Road, Ilford.Officers and the London Ambulance Service attended.The foetus - believed to be around - weeks gestation - is likely to have been disposed of early on the morning of  October.Officers are concerned about the welfare of the mother, and are appealing for her to contact the emergency services so she can receive any medical treatment she may require.Enquiries into the circumstances continue.Anyone with information is asked to contact the East Area Command Unit on  quoting CAD  OCT.

title: prince harry meghan markle first royal tour revealed australia new zealand
story: The -day trip will be packed with  engagements, with the Invictus Games Sydney  taking centre stage.The destination for the Duke and Duchess of Sussexs first official trip as husband and we mimics the princes parents first overseas tour, as they visited Australia in , shortly after their own wedding.Prince Harry and Meghan will leave London on October  for Australia where the Duke will climb Sydney Harbour Bridge to raise the Invictus Games’ flag.The newlyweds will also attend the games’ Opening Ceremony, before watching the sailing, cycling and wheelchair basketball events during late stages of their tour.The first day will see the pair visit Admiralty House, the official Sydney residence of the Governor-General of Australia, Sir Peter Cosgrove.The property boast spectacular views across Sydney Harbour, home to the iconic Sydney Opera House.Representatives from each of the  countries taking part in the Invictus Games will also be present.Among other highlights will be a visit to the world-famous Taronga Zoo where the pair will be able to meet two koalas and their joeys.Royal fans will remember it as the same zoo where Prince George delighted the world as he joyfully title: big ben remembrance sunday
story: London’s famous bell rang shortly after pm as a test ahead of Remembrance Sunday and New Year’s Eve.Big Ben was silenced in August last year at the start of a four-year plan to restore Westminster’s Elizabeth Tower.MP Stephen Pound, who tried to block the move, was in Parliament to hear the chimes.The Ealing North MP, who wiped away a tear as Big Ben was muted last year, said: Remembrance Sunday is a solemn occasion and the sonorous sound of the bells will certainly add to the sense of occasion.”He added: “I salute the courage of the bell master who agreed to let this happen and let the chimes of freedom ring out again over the city.”The Elizabeth Tower, home to the Great Clock and the Great Bell - known as Big Ben - is undergoing a complex programme of conservation works to safeguard it for generations to come.Parliaments team of clock mechanics temporarily disconnected Big Ben and the quarter bells from the clock mechanism and lowered the weights to the base of the tower in order to provide a safe environment for the people working in the Elizabeth Tower.A bespoke electric mechanism has been built to power the kg striking hammer in order to ensure the Great Bell can mark Remembrance Sunday and New Years Eve.Only the Great Bell - Big Ben - will strike. title: teddy boys 1950 pictures underground london parties nightlife

title: tusk favours canada style deal
story: In a stark message the EU Council chief warned time was running out fast to strike an agreement and the PM needed to “get down to business”.He said Britain should accept the bloc’s offer of an unprecedented trade and security pact, calling it a “true sign of respect”.His remarks were met with jubilation by eurosceptics including ex-Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson, who said they proved the PM’s soft Brexit plan was now a dead duck.The Polish eurocrat told Mrs May she has just two weeks to seal an exit package after holding talks with Irish leader Leo Varadkar in Brussels yesterday.He said: “From the very beginning, the EU offer has been not just a Canada deal, but a Canada plus plus plus deal.“Much further-reaching on trade, on internal security and on foreign policy cooperation.“This is a true measure of respect.And this offer remains in place.The EU is serious about getting the best possible deal.”Mr Tusk said the EU needs to see “maximum progress” at a summit starting on October the two sides are to reach a deal.He added: “Now the Tory party conference is over we should get down to business.”A key stumbling bloc to a Canada-style deal is the requirement the UK accepts a backstop that carves Northern Ireland out of its customs and regulatory sphere.But senior eurosceptics still leapt on the EU chief’s remarks and warned Mrs May she will end up with no deal at allshe perseveres with Chequers.Former foreign secretary Boris Johnson said: “Tusk’s Canada plus plus plus offer shows there is a superb way forward that can solve the Irish border problem and deliver a free trade based partnership that works well for both sides of the Channel - as I set out last week in my plan for a better Brexit.”Ex-Brexit Secretary David Davis added that it showed Downing Street was “wrong” to claim there is “no alternative to Chequers”.Referring to Mr Tusk, ex Ukip leader Nigel Farage implored the PM: “Please Mrs May, bite his hand off.”EU officials told The Sun that Mrs May will be given the chance to deliver a make-or-break pitch to leaders before they discuss Brexit over dinner.Speaking alongside the Council chief, Irish PM Leo Varadkar called for “a trading relationship with the UK after Brexit that’s as close as possible”.But just hours after his meeting with Mr Tusk the Irish PM appeared to pour cold water on the idea of a Canada-style trade deal.He said: “I don’t know what Canada plus plus plus means.It’s just a concept at this stage.He knows full well that we will not accept a deal which splits up the UK.And he also knows his comments yesterday make le more dficult for Mrs May — who he pretends to “respect”.And spare us the faux outrage about Jeremy Hunt’s comments. title: brexit deal very close leo varadkar
story: The blocs Brexit negotiators told national diplomats in Brussels late last night that a orce deal was almost there.Reuters UK Bureau chief Guy Faulconbridge this morning tweeted the news, hours after the Irish PM said he was hopeful a deal could be done in two weeks.The Pound got a boost against the Euro and the Dollar at the latest revelations.During talks with Brussels boss Donald Tusk last night, Mr Varadkar said it could take time to get a proper trade agreement in place, but was hopeful that a deal to sign off on the Northern Ireland border CAN be done in a fortnight.I think we are entering a critical and decisive stage of these negotiations and there is a good opportunity to clinch a deal over the next couple of weeks, he said positively.Theresa May faces a crunch summit with the other leaders of the  countries on October  and , and the clock is ticking to get an agreement signed off in time for our EU exit next March.Issues over the Northern Ireland border and what our future trade relationship with the bloc will look like have been hampering progress for months.If an agreement is reached at the October summit, Mrs May will take her deal back to MPs to vote on in the Commons within weeks.If a deal isnt signed by then, an emergency Brexit meeting in November has been pencilled in.Nothing will be sealed unless a backup plan for the Northern Ireland border can be reached.The EU want to keep Northern Ireland under the blocs customs rules after we leave, but the Prime Minister has ruled out this because it would effectively split up the UK with a border in the Irish sea.The DUP have said their lines are blood red on this - and they would withdraw their support for the PMshe betrayed them.It is understood that Mrs May is working on new plans - which could include a temporary all-UK customs union with the EU after we leave. But this could hamper Britains ability to do trade deals with other countries outside the bloc.Currently the border between Northern Ireland and the Republic is open with no checks on goods or people.Ireland and the UK are in a common travel area of passport-free movement.And as they are both in the EU single market, there is no restriction on goods and no tarfs.Leaders in London, Belfast, Dublin and Brussels are keen to avoid a hard border after Brexit — when the UK has vowed to leave the single market and customs union.This would mean border checks being reintroduced to monitor movement between jurisdictions operating under the two dferent regulatory systems.There were fears this could have jeopardised the Good Friday Agreement peace deal.Irish PM Leo Varadkar said he could block Brexit talks unless the UK signed a formal agreement not to have a hard border.If this happened Ireland’s businesses could be left paying tarfs on imports and exports with its biggest single trading partner, Britain.Some had suggested moving border checks across the Irish Sea — but Unionists and Brexiteers rejected that, saying it undermines the integrity of the UK.Northern Ireland parties including representatives from Sinn Fein and Alliance will meet Mr Barnier and Guy Verhofstadt today for talks in Brussels, and the DUP and UUP will have similar talks next week.But no new story: Saga Vanecek came across the worn weapon while she was swimming at the Vidöstern Lake in Tånnö in the south of the country.The accidental archaeologist told VN.se: “I felt something with my hand and thought it was a stick and then I lted it up and it had a handle that looked like it was a sword and then I lted it up and shouted at Dad: ‘Daddy I found a sword!’”Locals have joked that the finding of the pre-Viking blade makes Saga the “Queen of Sweden” likening her to King Arthur.In Arthurian legend the king of the Britons is handed the true Excalibur, after breaking the one he drew from the stone in battle, by the enchantress the Lady of the Lake.She found the  inch long sword on the day of the World Cup final during Europe’s scorcher of a summer which had led to the water level of the lake dropping signicantly.The low water level of the lake is the likely reason Saga managed to stumble across the sword.Sagas dad Andy Vanecek told The Local he at first thought his daughter had found a weird stick or branch in the water.It was only after he asked a pal to take a closer look that he found out it was likely to be an ancient relic.The Jönköping county museum - which is now preserving the historic item - said the sword was extremely well-preserved.Sagas discovery led the museum and local council to carry out further excavations at the site, finding a brooch from the rd Century.Mikael Nordström from the museum said: “The conservation process takes quite a long time because its a complicated environment with wood and leather, so they have several steps to make sure its preserved for the future.”The inquisitive eight-year-old only moved to Sweden last year from Minneapolis in the US so they could be closer to her mothers family.Her father added: “The cool thing is that Im a huge Minnesota Vikings fan, and this looks just like a Viking sword!”

title: brexit deal is very close
story: NewsBrexit deal is very close say reports as Irish PM claims it could be clinched in two weeksIt comes as the EUs chief negotiator Michel Barnier meets the DUP and Sinn Fein amid warnings of "jeopardy to the citizens of Northern Ireland"ShareCommentsByDan BloomOnline Political Editor:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT NewsEU chief negotiator Michel Barnier "Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA Brexit deal is finally very close, it was reported today as time ticks down to the deadline. EU negotiators made the comment at a behind-closed-doors meeting to diplomats in Brussels last night, according to Reuters. It comes hours after Irelands Prime Minister Leo Varadkar raised hope of a breakthrough in the next fortnight - ahead of a crunch Brussels summit on October . I think we are entering a critical and decisive stage of these negotiations and there is a good opportunity to clinch a deal over the next couple of weeks, he said. But Mr Varadkar warned it could take longer than the transition period to December  to agree a final EU-UK trade deal. And today the Irish Government urged Mrs May to bring forward her proposals to break the deadlock over the Northern Ireland border. It comes just hours after European Council President Donald Tusk threw a spanner in the works by appearing to back a Brexiteers Canada Plus plan - that critics say would not solve the border puzzle. Meanwhile the EUs chief negotiator Michel Barnier meets the main parties in Northern Ireland in Brussels today in a bid to break a deadlock over the Northern Irish border.  Politicians are stuck over how to avoid border checks between Northern Ireland and the Republic while not keeping the territory aligned to the EU. Theresa May has flatly rejected an EU proposal that would introduce dferent rules for Northern Ireland compared to the rest of the UK. DUP Westminster leader Nigel Dodds has warned the issue is a red line and any backstop extending current arrangements for Northern Ireland must be temporary. But Sinn Fein Vice President Michelle ONeill warned there was jeopardy to the citizens of Northern Ireland and the threat of damage to the Good Friday Agreement. In a direct challenge to Theresa Mays strategy, she told BBC Radio s Today programme: Our message is very clear to Michel Barnier today.

title: theresa left humiliated donald tusk
story: NewsTheresa May left humiliated as Donald Tusk appears to side with hardline Tory Brexiteers opposed to her Chequers plan And he accused Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunt of being “unwise” and “insulting” by comparing the EU to the Soviet UnionShareCommentsByMikey SmithPolitical reporter:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT NewsDonald Tusk seems to be supporting so-called Canada+++ "Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailTheresa May was left humiliated as EU President Donald Tusk appeared to side with hardline Tory Brexiteers opposed to her Chequers plan. In a brutal slapdown, timed for the day after Mrs May’s keynote speech to Conservative Party Conference, Mr Tusk offered the kind of Brexit deal backed by Jacob Rees-Mogg and ex-Brexit Secretary David Davis over her Chequers plan. And he accused Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunt of being “unwise” and “insulting” by comparing the EU to the Soviet Union.  It came as Mrs May’s negotiating team was left with just  days to finalise a Brexit deal ahead of crunch EU talks later this month. Brexit Secretary Dominic Raab is expected to head to Brussels for more talks next week. The  EU leaders are set to discuss Brexit over dinner on October th, and Britain has been told the pieces of a orce deal must be in place by the start of that week. The “Canada+++” deal suggested by the EU would keep Britain out of the Single Market and Customs Union, but would guarantee a free trade deal and cooperation on security matters. But Mr Tusk’s plan would keep Northern Ireland inside EU economic rules, something Mrs May has strongly rejected. In her speech on Wednesday, Mrs May repeated her call for the EU to show Britain “respect in the negotiations.  But Mr Tusk hit back, tweeting: “From the very Beginning, the EU offer has been a Canada+++ deal. Much further-reaching on trade, internal security and foreign policy cooperation. This is a true measure of respect. And this offer remains in place.” Speaking at Tory conference this week, Jacob Rees-Mogg referred to such a deal, also referred to as Super Canada - as Canada Supercalragilistiexpialidocious - which as you all know is a word developed by a nanny and nannies are jolly good things. Mr Tusk also hit back at Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunt, who compared the EU to the Soviet Union in his speech to Tory conference on Tuesday, saying it was as “unwise as it is insulting. Asked whether Mr Hunt should resign over his comments, made during his speech to Tory Conference in Birmingham, Mr Tusk replied: “Thats not my problem.” At a press briefing in Brussels, Mr Tusk said: In respecting our partners, we expect the same in .  “Comparing the EU to the Soviet Union is as unwise as it is insulting. The Soviet Union was about prisons and gulags, borders and walls, violence against citizens and neighbours. “The European Union is about freedom and human rights, prosperity and peace, le without fear, it is about democracy and pluralism - a continent without internal borders and walls.  “As the President of the European Council and someone who spent half his le in the Soviet bloc, I know what I am talking about. Standing beside Irish premier Leo Varadkar he slammed British politicians for rejecting EU proposals to keep Northern Ireland inside EU economic rules. He said: Emotional arguments that stress the issue of dignity sound attractive but they do not facilitate agreement.  “Every actor in this process has their dignity and confrontation in this field will not lead to anything good. “No one can expect that because of Brexit, the EU will give up its fundamental values and key interests. Meanwhile, the boss of RBS bank warned a no-deal Brexit could plunge the UK economy into recession. Ross McEwan, chief executive of the majority taxpayer-owned bank, told the BBC a “bad Brexit” could result in “zero or negative” economic growth. He said such poor growth would hit RBS’ share price. He also said the bank was becoming careful about lending to certain sectors of the economy - particularly retail and construction. RBS is still % owned by the taxpayer following its bailout  years ago.

title: you should renew your passport
story: NewsWhy you should renew your passport as soon as possible - or risk being barred from EuropeThe government has released documents that state, in the event of a no-deal Brexit, Brits "may be denied entry" to some EU countriestheir passport has less than six months until expiryShareCommentsByRobyn DarbyshireAudience Writer:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT Newsthis.style.displaynone" Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news politics video conservative-mp-brandishes-passport-commons-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true""Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailTheres been a lot of speculation about what Brexit will mean for our holidays - and plenty of us have been worried about whether well be able to travel to some of our favourite spots in Europe with the same ease were used to. Brits are now being advised they should renew their passports as soon as possibletheyre in their last year - or risk being barred from entering Europe in the event of a no-deal Brexit, the government warned on September . Ministers published documents confirming we will need to have passports that are valid for AT LEAST six monthswe want guaranteed entry into countries in the EU. That means some valid British passports will be completely useless in our neighbouring countrieswe leave without striking a deal.  Basically, the documents say that without a deal, British citizens risk being treated the same as those from outside the EU in the borderless Schengen zone. The documents state: If you plan to travel to the Schengen area after  March , to avoid any possibility of your adult British passport not complying with the Schengen Border Code we suggest that you check the issue date and make sure your passport is no older than  years and  months on the day of travel. For example,you’re planning to travel to the Schengen area on  March , your passport should have an issue date on or after  October . If your passport does not meet these criteria, you may be denied entry to any of the Schengen area countries, and you should renew your passport before you travel. These same rules apply to both adult and childrens passports - and the government recommends renewing as soon as possible as the passport issuing service can get busy.

title: man who climbed m1 road
story: NewsMan who climbed on M road sign in bizarre photograph claims he was admiring the viewPhillip Jones exploit saw the motorway closed, causing delays to thousands of commuters close to LoughboroughShareCommentsBySuzy Gibson:,  OCT NewsA police bodycam image shows Phillip Jones sat on top of a motorway gantry "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA man who downed nine pints before climbing onto a traffic sign above the M told a police officer he was admiring the view. The motorway had to be closed because of Phillip Jones bizarre exploit, and a police officers bodycam captured him balanced precariously above the busy road.He was seen perched on the matrix gantry close to Junction  close to Loughborough, Leicestershire Live reports.When quizzed about what he was doing up there, at about .am, Jones said he was walking home after downing nine pints of beer following his sht at a pub in Loughborough - and wondered how high the road sign was.  He said had been admiring the view for about  minutes and climbed down when asked to do so. The -year-old was given an eight month jail sentence, suspended for  months, after admitting causing a public nuisance. He was also ordered to do  hours of unpaid work and pay pound costs. The delay affecting thousands of motorists caused both carriageways to be closed for between  minutes and half an hour, with tailbacks stretching several miles, on Monday August . Phillip Plant, prosecuting, told Leicester Crown Court that thousands of commuters were affected. Police body cam footage played in court showed the defendant on top of the sign and when asked what he was doing, he replied: Im just enjoying the view.  The officer is heard saying: Its caused a few problems, its not a normal thing to do. I think, basically, people feared the worst. Mr Plant said: He was cooperative and climbed down. He was arrested and taken to Beaumont Leys Police Station. He said hed been walking home and when he saw the matrix sign he was curious to see how high it was. When he got to the top he thought he might jump, although made no attempt to do so. He said it was a spontaneous decision and he didnt think about the disruption it would cause.

title: most common flu myths debunked
story: NewsMost common flu myths debunked - how you can and cant catch the virusThe two most common methods used by Brits to try to ward off flu are dosing up on Vitamin C, and drinking a ‘hot toddy’ – a warm whiskey drink with honey and lemonShareCommentsByRichard Jenkins:,  OCT NewsMany people think they can catch flu from the flu jab "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email ‘Starve a fever’ and ‘the flu jab gives you flu ’ are some of the most commonly believed sickness myths, according to new research.A poll of , adults found one fth of the population fear catching flu BECAUSE they have had the flu jab. Worryingly, this  belief may be the reason why only  per cent of Brits are planning to be vaccinated against the virus this year. Ten per cent ly think going outside in the cold, especially with wet hair, can make you vulnerable to illness. Jane Devenish, pharmacist at Well Pharmacy, which commissioned the research, said: “Being cold or having wet hair doesn’t give you flu. “The only way to catch flu is by being exposed to the flu virus, and the virus peaks in winter. “However, there is some evidence that having a lower body temperature can lower your ability to fight off viruses, so listen to your grandmother’s advice and wrap up warm.”  The study also revealed the two most common methods used by Brits to try to ward off flu are dosing up on Vitamin C, and drinking a ‘hot toddy’ – a warm whiskey drink with honey and lemon. And people were equally confused about what to do when they were unlucky enough to get a bout of flu. One in four think you should sweat out the fever, nearly a fth believe you should starve it, and  per cent think the illness can be ‘cured’ by chicken soup. Jane Devenish added: “There is no evidence that vitamin C prevents flu, and alcohol actually lowers your immune system, lowering your body’s ability to ward off viruses like flu. “Sweating is the body’s natural way of lowering its temperature, and it’s important to reduce a fever by keeping cool and taking paracetamol.” “I would never recommend starving yourself. Chicken soup, like any fluids, is great for staying hydrated and nourishing your body which definitely helps recovery, but unfortunately nothing can really ‘cure’ flu.”It also emerged despite the fact that  per cent of Brits surveyed via OnePoll had experienced flu,  per cent have no intention of getting the flu jab this year.

title: woman who only went toilet
story: NewsWoman who only went to the toilet ONCE a week was so bloated by mystery illness that people thought she was pregnantEXCLUSIVE: Kayleigh Henning suffered from bloating, constipation and abdominal cramps for more than  yearsShareCommentsByLiz Dunphy:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT NewsKayleigh Henning suffered from bloating, constipation and abdominal cramps for more than  years, pictured here with husband Robert "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA woman who was so bloated by a mystery illness that people thought she was pregnant is now expecting her first child after beating illness by avoiding six common foods . Kayleigh Henning suffered from bloating, constipation and agonising abdominal cramps for more than  years. Her condition was so bad she could only go to the toilet once a week. Sleepless nights were spent curled up on the bathroom floor in agony while multiple doctors failed to correctly diagnose her problem. Kayleigh said: It was so annoying because everyone just assumed I was pregnant and wouldnt leave that alone - I was definitely not pregnant! Id wear tights or anything like that which normally fit me for the whole day. By the end of the day, Id be very uncomfortable and Id have pressure marks from my trousers or tights imprinted on my skin.  “It was pretty painful, which affects you mentally. You feel like you just dont want to go out anywhere. Id often find Id experience diarrhoea on nights out and that is obviously pretty embarrassing. So many times I wouldnt feel like going out. Because I was constipated, Id be going to the toilet only once a week. That in itself is disconcerting because youre thinking in the back of your head why havent I been to the toilet . I probably endured the problems all through my s, even at university. Id been to see my GP mainly because of constipation problems and Id get given fibre gel drinks, she says. Kayleighs situation came to a head when she graduated from Heriot-Watt University, in Edinburgh, and moved from Scotland to Northern Ireland that week.  “The stress of that culminated in my first visit to AE. I was really worried I wouldnt be able to fly back for the graduation ceremony because I was in so much pain. I was just curled up on the bathroom floor, because it was cold and the best place to be.” Tiredness and depression, caused by her painful and irritable symptoms, had became part of daily le for the then -year-old.  Doctors put the symptoms down to Irritable Bowel Syndromeand prescribed a drug they thought would help. Kayleigh went home and had her first nights sleep in - days, but she developed an allergic reaction to the drug and had to rush back to AE. On most occasions [at the GP] I dont know whether it was ignorance or easiness, I always got these fibre gel drinks which I used for quite a while until another GP told me to come off them because they were not a long-term solution. But then Kayleighs personal trainer mentioned food intolerances and said she could fast-track an elimination diet with a test which analyses IgG antibody reactionsto up to  food and drink ingredients provided by the company YorkTest . Kayleigh said: My trainer was intolerant to a few things and didnt know until she took the test. Since she has eliminated those things from her diet, she has felt so much better.” Kayleighs husband, Robert, has ME [chronic fatigue syndrome] and was also going through a rough time but couldnt understand why. Kayleigh says: Hes had a few allergy tests, but never any intolerance tests. He had already eliminated gluten and cows milk from his diet. His lunch consisted of a chicken breast, potatoes and an egg every day.  “Interestingly when he took the intolerance test, which I got for him as a Christmas present, he found he was intolerant to eggs! So as soon as he eliminated the eggs he felt better as well.” Although Robert had around  intolerances, from eggs to raspberries, the message from specialists was not to panic - and even that some intolerances can be reintroduced six months after eliminating them from a diet. Kayleighs test - the YorkTest FoodDrink Scan programme - also threw up several surprises, revealing she had reactions to cow’s milk, egg white, lentils, yeast, buckwheat and gluten. “I’m not surprised by cow’s milk or gluten and avoided them as much as possible, because I knew that they didnt agree with me. I was surprised by lentils - I loved making lentil soup and sweet potato and lentil stew - and of course lentils are seen as healthy,” she says. My borderline list had things like walnut, rhubarb and avocado, which I ate all the time as well. What the experts advise is to eliminate everything over a period of six months then you can start to reintroduce things. We dont necessarily do that, but we can enjoy things on occasions and not suffer because were not eating them every day. The test involves sending a finger-prick blood sample to a laboratory for analysis followed by up to two consultations with a nutritional therapist.  Kayleigh says: “I found the nutritional consultation very helpful. Particularly when it came to finding alternatives, especially for garlic! “She was able to provide much more specic information on what to avoid based on food groups and gave some great alternatives and recipes,” she says. As soon as Kayleigh started her elimination diet, she immediately felt better. “As I had already removed gluten, wheat and cow’s milk from my diet, I found it relatively easy to remove the remaining foods. The one I found most dficult was yeast. “I definitely feel much better, and I know when I have eaten something that I am intolerant to immediately. I havent been constipated since, I bloat much less, and I don’t experience the same stomach cramps, provided I steer clear of my trigger foods. I do eat the odd food I probably shouldnt, but at least I know the reason for any discomfort. I am so much happier, consistently comfortable and have regular bowel movements, too.
